Posts.Content: FIrst I went to Susan G Komen BC site, then, discovering the different types of reconstruction, I think I did a google search.
Posts.Title: dieop flap ?'s

Posts.Content: Does anyone know just how fast this form of cancer grows? Can it deveope within a few weeks or months, like 3-4 months? I discovered a lump about a month ago and had my mammo & ultra last week. The lump is (was) 3x4 cm. I will be seeing a sergeon this week for a biopsy. My breast feels far worse than last week, hurts, and the lump feels much larger. Today I noticed a pink, sort of marble-like color, to the underside of my breast. I am very frightened.
Posts.Title: Inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Radiation may be not possible as I recently had a pacemaker implanted and would need to relocated it below my stomach. Of course if it is absolutely necessary I will have to do it, but that would require more surgery and expense.
Posts.Title: Inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Radiation may be not possible as I recently had a pacemaker implanted and would need to relocated it below my stomach. Of course if it is absolutely necessary I will have to do it, but that would require more surgery and expense.
Posts.Title: Inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: I saw my surgeon today and he wants to do a biopsy ASAP, as he believes this is IBC. In fact it appears the growth has grown considerably since my mammogram on June 1st. HE wanted to perform the procedure this Friday but his nurse told me I would have to wait 3 weeks. My son, “hopefully in remission himself, was very upset with this nurse who continue to state, as long as you haven’t had the biopsy or the results, there’s no issue. She continues to stick her head in the sand as my son tried over and over again to say, “what if this is IBC, and it could spread well your waiting and ignoring”. He wants me to call another Dr in the morning and see if I can have by biopsy in a day or 2. The Dr explained needle and core biopsy but removal of the entire tumor, his preference. AM I wrong not to want to wait that 2-3 weeks?
Posts.Title: Inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: The surgeon I saw yesterday explained the needle, core and removal of the entire lump to me. He recommended the complete removal as sometimes the needle biopsy will come back negative, giving a false hope of no cancer. He said the normal procedure is removal of the entire growth, then follow immediately with chemo. He wants to remove this ASAP, but his nurse will not book me for 3 weeks! The growth was the size of a golf ball on June 1, (day of mammo) and yesterday had MORE than doubled. The issue now is, he wants to do it this Friday, but his nurse was trying to make me wait 3 weeks. My husband called to speak to him this morning and the nurse will not allow them to talk. SHe just called a few minutes ago and said they coudl move it up to 2 weeks but cannot reach my PCP for a preop pysicial. Of all times for my doctor to be moving hewr office. Neither of her phone numbers old off or new, are working.
Posts.Title: Inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: I think htere is something wrong with the link...doesn't work.
Posts.Title: Inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Tomorrow I'll have my Excisional Breast Biospy, which I hear is similar to a lumpectomy except more surrounding tissue and skin is removed. My lump was "golfball" size on June 1st, and more than doubled by the 11th. I have been feeling very tired and HUNGRY all the time, but not really wanting to eat. I have sharp knife stabbing pain in the area of the tumor. What I fear is the hungar is a sign the tumor is growing faster. Both my mom and GM died from BC, so I am very frighten. I am having the surgery at 11 am does any one think the doctor may know something following the surgery or will I have to wait until next week? All this waiting is driving me nutsl.
Posts.Title: Hungery sign Cancer is growing?

Posts.Content: I think htere is something wrong with the link...doesn't work.
Posts.Title: Inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: I have recieved a copy of the pathologist report, but do not understand it, can anyone help? 1) Invasive ductal adenocarcinoma, histologic grade III / III (tubule formation 3, nuclear grade 3, mitosis 3; 9/9) with necrosis. 2)Then it went on to say a Breast Profile was ordered for block B6 - is this just requesting another look at a slide? I spoke with the onocologic's office but cannot be seen until July 17th...is that too long a wait?
Posts.Title: Invasive ductal adenocarcinoma

Posts.Content: I have seen 3 doctors all believe I may have IBC . I am having a Excisonal Biospy with Overlying Skin next Friday. I was told that if it is IBC that I shoudl not have a lumpectomy, but chemo first. DOes anyone know the difference between these 2 procedures? And what about the "overlying Skin"? DOes this mean they will be removing part of the outer side of my breast in addition to the lump?
Posts.Title: Excisional Breast Biopsy with Overlying Skin

Posts.Content: On 4/20/2009 jenniferbal wrote: Hi Everyone: I was diagnosed with TN Breast Cancer in June 2008 and have had 2 surgeries and am currently undergoing Chemo. I have started a blog to help myself and others through this ordeal. Please feel free to follow it at http://3nbreastcancer.blogspot.com/  " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://3nbreastcancer.blogspot.com/  or pass along the link to anyone who may benefit.   Your link doesn't work but in a round about way I did get to "Jen's 3N Breast Cancer Chemo Blog - is that the correct place?   http://3nbreastcancer.blogspot.com/  " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://3nbreastcancer.blogspot.com/
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Chemo Blog

Posts.Content: I know what you are going thru because I am going thru the very same thing...NOW. Two weeks ago, I was having some pain and it was Friday night. I felt the area I was experiencing the pain and discovered a LARGE lump. The weekend seemed extremely long, waiting for my Doctors office to open Monday morning. My PCP said the lump is thumb size and ordered a mamo and ultrasound. The Mamo shows a large growth, but the ultrasound...nothing. I am now waiting to see the surgeon. It seems like a long wait as I cannot get in to see him until June 11th, and that appointment is only a consultation. I have no idea how long it will be before I have the biopsy. I am very scared as both my mother and grandmother died from breast cancer.
Posts.Title: Scared and need info

Posts.Content: Has anyone with a pacemaker had a port inserted for chemo ? I had a pacemaker implanted almost a year ago, and now I'll be seeing my new oncolgist July 17th to start my chemo. I really am not looking forward to all those IVs as my veins "roll". But I am afraid I will not be able to have a port inserted because of the PM and it's leads, which are already in the area the port would be going. Jean
Posts.Title: Ports with Pacemakers
